summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to Peter Skinner regarding a sealed court order. The order grants permission for the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP to comply with a grand jury subpoena by producing confidential discovery materials from the case 'v. Maxwell, 15 Civ. 7433'. The email clarifies the order's scope and attaches relevant documents.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Addressed as 'Mr. Skinner' in an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding a sealed court order and subpoena compliance.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Copied on an email concerning a sealed order and subpoena related to the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, providing a sealed order and instructions regarding a grand jury subpoena to the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.

connections.description: The prosecutor is communicating legal instructions and providing a court order to Peter Skinner.
The prosecutor copied Sigrid McCawley on the email regarding the subpoena and court order.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was served on the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP in connection with the case 'v. Maxwell, 15 Civ. 7433'.

events.title: Sealed Order Issued
events.description: A sealed court order was issued, granting permission for Boies Schiller Flexner LLP to comply with the grand jury subpoena by producing confidential discovery materials.

keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was served on the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP on February 5, 2019, in connection with the Ghislaine Maxwell case (15 Civ. 7433).
A sealed court order, dated April 15, 2019, permitted the law firm to comply with the subpoena by producing materials marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' under the case's protective order.
The email explicitly states the order applies only to the Maxwell case (15 Civ. 7433) and not to other litigation, such as 'In re Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al., 17 Civ. 0616'.
The correspondence involves an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York directing the legal process for document production.
